word: This blighted fig tree with its pretentious branches is to repeat its lesson in every age to the close of this earth’s history. . . . If the spirit of Satan entered unto unsanctified hearts in the days of Christ to counterwork the requirements of God in that generation, it will surely enter into the professed Christian churches in [our day]. History will repeat itself. . . . But the people who obey the commandments of God have no controversy. They take the Word of God for their guide.—Manuscript 32, 1898.
